valid_articles.Title: Bing begins testing a feature that displays 'generative AI summaries' at the top
valid_articles.Description: Microsoft has announced that it will introduce a search function using generative AI to its search engine 'Bing.' The new search screen displays a summary of search results generated by AI at the top, and testing has already begun for a small number of users. Introducing Bing generative search | Bing Search Blog https://blogs.bing.com/search/July-2024/generativesearch In conventional search engines, you need to search for what you want by dividing it into words, such as 'what does ____ mean' or 'what is ____'. On the other hand, Bing, which is equipped with generative AI, allows you to search in natural sentences, such as 'What does ____ mean?' In addition, the most prominent part of the search results displays 'answers compiled by generative AI based on the search results.' Here's an example of a search using Bing with generative AI: First, search for the sentence 'What is a spaghetti western?'  Then, a list of answers that clearly show that 'spaghetti western' is a genre of western f

valid_articles.Description: With about 100 days until Election Day, politically focused startups see AI as a way to help national and local candidates quickly react to unexpected change.

valid_articles.Title: Where Kamala Harris and Donald Trump stand on big tech issues
valid_articles.Description: The next U.S. president is going to have a tough job of reining in social media companies' dominance and power enough to satisfy lawmakers and users, while still encouraging free speech, privacy and innovation.
